framed.solvers package¶

Submodules¶

framed.solvers.cplex_interface module¶

This module implements a CPLEX interface.

Author: Daniel Machado

class framed.solvers.cplex_interface.CplexSolver(model=None)¶

Bases: framed.solvers.solver.Solver

Implements the solver interface using CPLEX.

add_constraint(constr_id, lhs, sense='=', rhs=0, persistent=True, update_problem=True)¶

Add a constraint to the current problem.

Parameters:
  • constr_id (str) – constraint identifier
  • lhs (dict) – variables and respective coefficients
  • sense (str) – constraint sense (any of: ‘<’, ‘=’, ‘>’; default ‘=’)
  • rhs (float) – right-hand side of equation (default: 0)
  • persistent (bool) – if the variable should be reused for multiple calls (default: True)
  • update_problem (bool) – update problem immediately (not supported in CPLEX interface)
add_constraints(constr_ids, lhs, senses, rhs)¶

Add a list of constraints to the current problem.

Parameters:
  • constr_ids (list) – constraint identifiers
  • lhs (list) – variables and respective coefficients
  • senses (list) – constraint senses (default: ‘=’)
  • rhs (list) – right-hand side of equations (default: 0)
add_variable(var_id, lb=None, ub=None, vartype=3, persistent=True, update_problem=True)¶

Add a variable to the current problem.

Parameters:
  • var_id (str) – variable identifier
  • lb (float) – lower bound
  • ub (float) – upper bound
  • vartype (VarType) – variable type (default: CONTINUOUS)
  • persistent (bool) – if the variable should be reused for multiple calls (default: true)
  • update_problem (bool) – update problem immediately (ignored in CPLEX interface)
add_variables(var_ids, lbs, ubs, vartypes)¶

Add multiple variables to the current problem.

Parameters:
  • var_ids (list) – variable identifier
  • lbs (list) – lower bounds
  • ubs (list) – upper bounds
  • vartypes (list) – variable types (default: CONTINUOUS)
build_problem(model)¶

Create problem structure for a given model.

Parameters:model – CBModel
remove_constraint(constr_id)¶

Remove a constraint from the current problem.

Parameters:constr_id (str) – constraint identifier
remove_variable(var_id)¶

Remove a variable from the current problem.

Parameters:var_id (str) – variable identifier
reset_bounds(updated_lb, updated_ub)¶
set_logging(enabled=False)¶

Enable or disable log output:

Parameters:enabled (bool) – turn logging on (default: False)
set_objective(linear=None, quadratic=None, minimize=True)¶

Set a predefined objective for this problem.

Parameters:
  • linear (dict) – linear coefficients (optional)
  • quadratic (dict) – quadratic coefficients (optional)
  • minimize (bool) – solve a minimization problem (default: True)

Notes

Setting the objective is optional. It can also be passed directly when calling solve.

set_parameter(parameter, value)¶

Set a parameter value for this optimization problem

Parameters:
  • parameter (Parameter) – parameter type
  • value (float) – parameter value
solve(linear=None, quadratic=None, minimize=None, model=None, constraints=None, get_values=True, get_shadow_prices=False, get_reduced_costs=False)¶

Solve the optimization problem.

Parameters:
  • linear (dict) – linear objective (optional)
  • quadratic (dict) – quadratic objective (optional)
  • minimize (bool) – solve a minimization problem (default: True)
  • model (CBModel) – model (optional, leave blank to reuse previous model structure)
  • constraints (dict) – additional constraints (optional)
  • get_values (bool) – set to false for speedup if you only care about the objective value (default: True)
  • get_shadow_prices (bool) – return shadow prices if available (default: False)
  • get_reduced_costs (bool) – return reduced costs if available (default: False)
Returns:

solution
Return type:

Solution
temporary_bounds(constraints)¶
update()¶
write_to_file(filename)¶

Write problem to file:

Parameters:filename (str) – file path

framed.solvers.gurobi_interface module¶

Implementation of a Gurobi solver interface.

Author: Daniel Machado

class framed.solvers.gurobi_interface.GurobiSolver(model=None)¶

Bases: framed.solvers.solver.Solver

Implements the solver interface using gurobipy.

Add a constraint to the current problem.

  • lhs (dict) – variables and respective coefficients
  • sense (str) – constraint sense (any of: ‘<’, ‘=’, ‘>’; default ‘=’)
  • rhs (float) – right-hand side of equation (default: 0)
  • persistent (bool) – if the variable should be reused for multiple calls (default: True)
  • update_problem (bool) – update problem immediately (default: True)

solve(linear=None, quadratic=None, minimize=None, model=None, constraints=None, get_values=True, get_shadow_prices=False, get_reduced_costs=False)¶

Solve the optimization problem.

Parameters:
  • linear (dict) – linear objective (optional)
  • quadratic (dict) – quadratic objective (optional)
  • minimize (bool) – solve a minimization problem (default: True)
  • model (CBModel) – model (optional, leave blank to reuse previous model structure)
  • constraints (dict) – additional constraints (optional)
  • get_values (bool) – set to false for speedup if you only care about the objective value (default: True)
  • get_shadow_prices (bool) – return shadow prices if available (default: False)
  • get_reduced_costs (bool) – return reduced costs if available (default: False)
Returns:

solution
Return type:

Solution

framed.solvers.solver module¶

This module implements abstract classes common to any solver interface.

Author: Daniel Machado

exception framed.solvers.solver.OptimizationWarning¶

Bases: exceptions.UserWarning

class framed.solvers.solver.Parameter¶

Enumeration of parameters common to all solvers.

FEASIBILITY_TOL = 1¶
INT_FEASIBILITY_TOL = 2¶
MIP_ABS_GAP = 5¶
MIP_REL_GAP = 4¶
OPTIMALITY_TOL = 3¶
TIME_LIMIT = 0¶
class framed.solvers.solver.Solution(status=0, message=None, fobj=None, values=None, shadow_prices=None, reduced_costs=None)¶

Stores the results of an optimization.

Instantiate without arguments to create an empty Solution representing a failed optimization.

get_metabolites_turnover(model)¶

Calculate metabolite turnover.

Parameters:model (CBModel) – model that generated the solution
Returns:metabolite turnover rates
Return type:dict
show_metabolite_balance(m_id, model, zeros=False, sort=False, percentage=False, equations=False)¶

Show metabolite balance details.

Parameters:
  • m_id (str) – metabolite id
  • model (CBModel) – model that generated the solution
  • zeros (bool) – show zero entries (default: False)
  • sort (bool) – sort reactions by flux (default: False)
  • percentage (bool) – show percentage of total turnover instead of flux (default: False)
  • equations (bool) – show reaction equations (default: False)
Returns:

formatted output
Return type:

str
show_metabolite_turnover(model, zeros=False, pattern=None, sort=False, abstol=1e-09)¶

Show solution results.

Parameters:
  • model (CBModel) – model that generated the solution
  • zeros (bool) – show zero values (default: False)
  • pattern (str) – show only reactions that contain pattern (optional)
  • sort (bool) – sort values by magnitude (default: False)
Returns:

printed table
Return type:

str
show_reduced_costs(zeros=False, pattern=None, abstol=1e-09)¶

Show reduced costs.

Parameters:
  • zeros (bool) – show zero values (default: False)
  • pattern (str) – show only reactions that contain pattern (optional)
Returns:

printed table with shadow prices
Return type:

str
show_shadow_prices(zeros=False, pattern=None, abstol=1e-09)¶

Show shadow prices.

Parameters:
  • zeros (bool) – show zero values (default: False)
  • pattern (str) – show only metabolites that contain pattern (optional)
Returns:

printed table with shadow prices
Return type:

str
show_values(zeros=False, pattern=None, sort=False, abstol=1e-09)¶

Show solution results.

Parameters:
  • zeros (bool) – show zero values (default: False)
  • pattern (str) – show only reactions that contain pattern (optional)
  • sort (bool) – sort values by magnitude (default: False)
Returns:

printed table with variable values
Return type:

str
class framed.solvers.solver.Solver(model=None)¶

Abstract class representing a generic solver.

All solver interfaces should implement the methods defined in this class.

add_constraint(constr_id, lhs, sense='=', rhs=0, persistent=True, update_problem=True)¶

Add a constraint to the current problem.

Parameters:
  • constr_id (str) – constraint identifier
  • lhs (dict) – variables and respective coefficients
  • sense (str) – constraint sense (any of: ‘<’, ‘=’, ‘>’; default ‘=’)
  • rhs (float) – right-hand side of equation (default: 0)
  • persistent (bool) – if the variable should be reused for multiple calls (default: True)
  • update_problem (bool) – update problem immediately (default: True)
add_variable(var_id, lb=None, ub=None, vartype=3, persistent=True, update_problem=True)¶

Add a variable to the current problem.

Parameters:
  • var_id (str) – variable identifier
  • lb (float) – lower bound
  • ub (float) – upper bound
  • vartype (VarType) – variable type (default: CONTINUOUS)
  • persistent (bool) – if the variable should be reused for multiple calls (default: true)
  • update_problem (bool) – update problem immediately (default: True)
build_problem(model)¶

Create problem structure for a given model.

Parameters:model – CBModel
clean_up(clean_variables=True, clean_constraints=True)¶

Clean up all non persistent elements in the problem.

Parameters:
  • clean_variables (bool) – remove non persistent variables (default: True)
  • clean_constraints (bool) – remove non persistent constraints (default: True)

Set a predefined objective for this problem.

  • quadratic (dict) – quadratic coefficients (optional)
  • minimize (bool) – solve a minimization problem (default: True)

Notes

Parameters:parameters (dict of Parameter to value) – parameter values
solve(linear=None, quadratic=None, minimize=None, model=None, constraints=None, get_values=True, get_shadow_prices=False, get_reduced_costs=False)¶

Solve the optimization problem.

Parameters:
  • linear (dict) – linear objective (optional)
  • quadratic (dict) – quadratic objective (optional)
  • minimize (bool) – solve a minimization problem (default: True)
  • model (CBModel) – model (optional, leave blank to reuse previous model structure)
  • constraints (dict) – additional constraints (optional)
  • get_values (bool) – set to false for speedup if you only care about the objective value (default: True)
  • get_shadow_prices (bool) – return shadow prices if available (default: False)
  • get_reduced_costs (bool) – return reduced costs if available (default: False)
Returns:

solution
Return type:

Solution

Update internal structure. Used for efficient lazy updating.

Parameters:filename (str) – file path
class framed.solvers.solver.Status¶

Enumeration of possible solution status.

INFEASIBLE = -3¶
INF_OR_UNB = -4¶
OPTIMAL = 1¶
SUBOPTIMAL = -1¶
UNBOUNDED = -2¶
UNKNOWN = 0¶
class framed.solvers.solver.VarType¶

Enumeration of possible variable types.

BINARY = 1¶
CONTINUOUS = 3¶
INTEGER = 2¶
framed.solvers.solver.set_default_parameter(parameter, value)¶

Change the value for a given parameter (see list of supported parameters).

Parameters:
  • parameter (Parameter) – parameter type
  • value (float) – parameter value

Module contents¶

Package implementing interfaces to linear programming solvers.

Author: Daniel Machado, Marta Matos

framed.solvers.get_default_solver()¶
framed.solvers.set_default_solver(solvername)¶

Sets default solver.

Parameters:solvername – str – solver name (currently available: gurobi, cplex, glpk)
framed.solvers.solver_instance(model=None)¶

Returns a new instance of the currently selected solver.

Parameters:model – CBModel (optional) – immediatly instantiate problem with given model
Returns:Solver
